question: Question_06_(e)
statement:
Suppose that \emph{A} is a matrix with singular value decomposition
$A = U\Sigma V^*$ where

\begin{align*}
U = & \begin{bmatrix}
1/\sqrt 2 & 1/\sqrt 2 & 0 \\
1/\sqrt 2 & -1/\sqrt 2 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & 1
\end{bmatrix} \\
\Sigma = & \begin{bmatrix}
2 & 0 & 0 \\
0 & 1 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & 1/2
\end{bmatrix} \\
V = & \begin{bmatrix}
1/\sqrt 3 & 0 & 2/\sqrt 6 \\
1/\sqrt 3 & 1/\sqrt 2 & -1/\sqrt 6 \\
1/\sqrt 3 & -1/\sqrt 2 & -1/\sqrt 6
\end{bmatrix}
\end{align*}

\textbf{(e)} What are the matrix norm $\|A^{-1}\|$ and the condition
number of \emph{A}?
sols:
From
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2012/Question_06_(d)}{part
(c)}, $A^{-1} = V\Sigma^{-1}U^T$, and using the same logic as
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2012/Question_06_(c)}{part
(c)} we find that $\left \| A^{-1} \right \| = \|\Sigma^{-1}\| = 2$. The
condition number is then

\[\left \| A^{-1} \right \|\cdot \left \| A \right \| = 2\cdot 2=4.\]
hints:
Use that $A^{-1} = V\Sigma^{-1}U^T$ and the same argument as in
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2012/Question_06_(c)}{part
(c)} to relate the norm of \emph{A\textsuperscript{-1}} with the norm of
$\Sigma^{-1}$.

The condition number is given by

\[\kappa(A) = \left\Vert A^{-1} \right\Vert \cdot \left\Vert A \right\Vert\]
